DOCNAME: CASE OF VAN VELDEN v. THE NETHERLANDS
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 5-4;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was caught in the act of trying to defraud a bank by withdrawing a sum of money from someone else ’s bank account using a forged identity document . He was arrested and placed in police custody ( inverzekeringstelling ) for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE an investigating judge ( rechter - commissaris ) placed the applicant in initial detention on remand ( inbewaringstelling ) for a term of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( rechtbank ) of GPE , following a hearing in camera , dismissed the applicant ’s request for suspension ( schorsing ) of his detention on remand ( voorlopige hechtenis ) and ordered the applicant ’s further detention on remand ( gevangenhouding ) for DATE . The applicant was at that time detained in the remand centre ( huis van bewaring ) of GPE ( north wing of GPE prison ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel lodged a single appeal against both the refusal to suspend the applicant ’s detention on remand and the order for the applicant ’s further detention on remand .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( gerechtshof ) of The GPE rejected the appeal under both heads as out of time .
CARDINAL . On DATE the unit manager of the north wing of FAC replied to a query from the applicant ’s counsel in the following terms :
“ Dear Mr PERSON ,
We have received your letter concerning ORG decision in good order .

In response to your request , I wish to inform you that ORG took the decision in question on CARDINAL . On CARDINAL the document was posted from ORG , on CARDINAL we received the document in DATE TIME post , and on CARDINAL the document was delivered to the prison inmates administration in the afternoon , and on CARDINAL the document was handed to Mr GPE . ( see the copy of the official delivery record ( akte van uitreiking ) ) ... ”

CARDINAL . It appears that ORG decision refusing to order the suspension of the applicant ’s detention on remand was served on the applicant in writing on DATE at TIME A copy of the official delivery record was submitted by the applicant , annexed to the application .

CARDINAL . After the case was communicated , the respondent Government submitted a copy of an official delivery record showing that ORG order for the applicant ’s further detention on remand was served on the applicant on CARDINAL DATE at TIME The document bears the applicant ’s signature acknowledging receipt .
CARDINAL . The Government have also submitted a copy of a written notice of appeal , which is in the following terms ( emphasis in the original ) :
“ ORG of GPE
Legal remedy notice ( Akte rechtsmiddel )
On DATE there appeared at ORG
PERSON

who declared that he had been specifically empowered by the person named hereafter to make the following statement , and stated , in the name of

that he appealed against the decision and against the rejection of his request for suspension taken by ORG in camera on DATE . ”
The document is signed by PERSON and by the registrar of ORG .

CARDINAL . It appears from the Government ’s submissions that the applicant was sentenced to a term of imprisonment from which the time which he had spent in detention on remand was deducted in its entirety ( LAW ( PERSON ) , see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The applicant does not deny this .
CARDINAL . The Code of Criminal procedure ( PERSON ) , in relevant part , provides as follows :

“ CARDINAL . An order for further detention on remand , or for the prolongation thereof , shall be in force for a period of DATE , to be determined by ORG , starting at the moment of its execution . ... ”
“ CARDINAL . The suspect can lodge an appeal with ORG against ORG decision to order or extend his further detention on remand DATE after the execution thereof . ... ”

CARDINAL . Within the same time - limit , the suspect can appeal against an order to prolong his further detention on remand , but only if he did not appeal against the order for detention on remand , nor against an earlier prolongation order . ... ”

CARDINAL . An order for detention on remand shall enter into force as of the moment at which the suspect is detained for the purpose of the execution of that order or as of the time at which the execution of a different order for detention on remand , given in the same case , ends , as the case may be . ... ”

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant who has sought the termination or suspension of his detention on remand may lodge an appeal against a refusal of that request with ORG once , within DATE of the service of that decision . The suspect who has appealed against a decision refusing a request for suspension of detention on remand can not afterwards appeal against a decision refusing the lifting of detention on remand . The suspect who has appealed against a decision refusing a request for suspension of detention on remand can not afterwards appeal against a decision refusing the suspension of detention on remand . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . Except as otherwise provided by law , an appeal or appeal on points of law shall be introduced by a declaration to be made by the person making use of the legal remedy at the registry of the court by which or within which the decision has been given . ... ”
“ CARDINAL . Legal remedies , as referred to in Article CARDINAL , can also be made use of through the offices of :
a. an advocate , if he or she declares that he has been specifically empowered for that purpose by the person making use of the legal remedy ; ... ”

“ CARDINAL . If the person who wishes to make use of a legal remedy is detained in a remand centre , prison or custodial clinic , ... then he can also make use of the legal remedies ... by means of a written declaration submitted to the person in charge of the institution .

CARDINAL . NORP The person in charge of the institution shall have this declaration entered in a register kept for that purpose without delay , and then forward it to the registry of the court by which , or within which , the decision has been given , stating the date of entry in the register . The date on which the legal remedy is made use of shall be deemed to be the date of the entry in the register . ... ”
CARDINAL . The General Time Limits Act ( Algemene Termijnenwet ) , in relevant part , provides as follows :
“ A time limit prescribed by law of DATE shall , if necessary , be extended so that it shall comprise DATE which are not a DATE , a DATE or a public holiday . ”

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( GPE ) requires the courts when sentencing in all cases to deduct from the sentence the time which the convicted person has spent in police custody and detention on remand .
